page.title: 04Employment--Denny & dunipace
page.content: {Local Councils}provide one of the main sources of employment in this area. Many people are employed in house or road maintenance, gardening or refuse collections. Small businesses, set up by people who have taken part in retraining schemes, have been opening up in disused buildings in the town. These buildings have been converted into small work units and are rented out on a month to month basis. One such enterprise, known as the {DENNY {WORKSPACE,}has room for 17 workshops. Here the new businesses offer a range of high technological products. In the {GRANARY}new firms offer a service to the public eg. shoe repairing, car maintenance. Seven women, known as the {Duncarron Spinners,}have formed a workers' cooperative. They produce all kinds of knitwear which they hope to sell in Britain and overseas.
